SENT.plain: The clinical and computed tomography (CT) features of 25 patients with peripartum CVT are described
Majority of the patients presented in postpartum period and did not receive proper antenatal care
Headache (92%), altered sensorium (80%, seizures (76%), papilloedema (80%) and hemiplegia (52%) were the common modes of presentation
CT findings included diffuse brain oedema (52%), haemorrhagic or nonhaemorrhagic infarctions on one or both sides of brain (48%), gyral enhancement (40%) and tentorial enhancement (16%)
While 15 patients made good recovery, 3 cases (12%) died during acute stage of illness
